channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Distraction-free Workplace - Escape Standups and Scrum - Perl Developer West London
item.description: Client is a small development team where everyone is expected to pull their own weight. No daily standups, no planning poker, just you and your work, aided by some of the most experienced technical colleagues in London. Youâ€™ll be encouraged to make sensible use of Modern Perl tooling and grow your personal experience of best development practices under excellent technical leadership.

item.title: DNA and Dancer Down Under â€“ mid-level developer required for a bioinformatics company in Canberra
item.description: Sitting right at the junction of technology and life sciences, this is a unique role. The companyâ€™s priority is to hire a candidate with excellent modern Perl skills, so they are happy to consider strong developers coming from other industries who show a genuine interest in moving into the bioinformatics field.

item.title: Senior Perl Contractor who wants to Learn Python -- Work from home + Cambridge, UK
item.description: Perl codebase running very commercially successful product in rapidly expanding company. Full-time on-site (Cambridge UK) for 4 weeks, then 2-3 days telecommute a week. New features in a mixture of Perl and Python â€“ a chance to cross-train to Python with no prior experience needed.

item.title: Principal Perl Developer Wanted for Wild Ride â€“ Python, Golang and Node Experience a huge plus
item.description: Big brand with a fun and energetic voice is looking for an experienced Perl developer. The company dominates its industry, providing crucial, up-to-the-minute information for millions of people annually. As such, the data it uses for mining, analysis, and manipulation must be reliable and thoroughly clean.

item.title: Come be a Perl developer in the smartest city in the USA
item.description: We arenâ€™t a sexy Silicon Valley start-up with lots of venture capital backing us and swinging for the fences. Instead, weâ€™re an established business with a long-term reputation for being one of the best hosting companies in the world. We arenâ€™t sexy. Weâ€™re comfortable. And unlike most startups, we know weâ€™ll still be around tomorrow.

item.description: One of the consistent blogger for Perl Weekly Challenger. Here Laurent shares his ideas and thoughts with regards to his solution for Challenge 006.

item.title: #406 - Perl Toolchain Summit - 2019
item.description:
Hi there

Recently Perl Toolchain Summit 2019 event took place in the town of Marlow, UK between Thursday April 25th and Sunday 28th 2019. For those who don't know what PTS is? The Perl Toolchain summit is an opportunity for the developers and maintainers of Perl's infrastructure to get together and do whatever is necessary to keep that infrastructure running well and improve its services. This is invite only event.

During the event, there were regular photo updates on Twitter to get the view what is happening. I met Lee Johnson, one of the attendee, the following day. I really wanted to meet all of them personally as the venue was not far from where I live. It is rare to see so many gurus in one place. I didn't want to turn up without invitation and embarass myself.

I wanted to be involved in MetaCPAN project, so that one day I also get invitation. Unfortunately setting up MetaCPAN locally is not easy. Paul johnson, another attendee at PTS, told me that there was some discussion going on to make the process simple and straight forward. I am eagerly waiting for it.

In the mean time, if you want looking for the event's photo, then take a look at Wendy's collection here

Enjoy and have fun rest of the week.
